author: joeyaiello
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
function foo {}
Set-PSBreakpoint -Command foo
foo
```

1. The debugger will break.
1. Run some long-running task that you'll have time to Ctrl+C, but that will finish in a reasonable time. I used `ls ~\Downloads`.
1. Ctrl+C (once) before the command finishes. It won't work.
1. When the command finishes, observe that the debugger is no longer attached. 

# Expected behavior

It's expected that the command being executed from within the debugger will be killed, but that the debugger will not be killed and remain attached.

# Actual behavior

The command doesn't halt execution, and the debugger is unattached at the end of its execution.
